article.title: Mice in Bion-M 1 space mission: training and selection

nodes.description: Bion-M 1 is a biosatellite that conducted a 30-day flight from April 19 to May 19, 2013, as part of Russia's biomedical research program in space. It was designed for life-science experiments and primarily used male mice for physiological studies.

Russia is the country that resumed its biomedical research program in space in 2013, following a 16-year hiatus. The program includes various animal species for research, with a focus on understanding physiological adaptations to microgravity.

Mus musculus, commonly known as the house mouse, was the principal species used in the Bion-M 1 project for biomedical research in space. Male mice were specifically chosen for this mission to study their physiological adaptations to microgravity.

Laika was a Soviet space dog that became the first living organism to orbit Earth in 1957. Laika's successful flight demonstrated the viability of living organisms in space and paved the way for future biomedical research with animals.
C57/BL6 is a specific strain of laboratory mice used in the Bion-M 1 project. This strain was selected for its suitability in biomedical studies and was housed in space habitats during the mission.

The Bion biosatellites program is a series of missions that have utilized various animal species to study the effects of microgravity on biological systems. It has contributed significant data on adaptive responses to spaceflight conditions.

Mice are small mammals that have become the most prevalent mammalian model in biomedical research. They possess a fully described genome and are commonly used in genetically engineered studies, particularly in molecular biology.
Spaceflight refers to the act of traveling into or through outer space. It presents unique conditions such as microgravity, which can significantly affect biological systems.

The International Space Station (ISS) is a habitable artificial satellite that orbits Earth, serving as a microgravity research laboratory where scientific research is conducted in astrobiology, astronomy, meteorology, physics, and other fields.
C57BL/6J is a specific strain of laboratory mouse widely used in research due to its well-documented genetics and behavior.
The Mice Drawer System (MDS) is an experiment conducted by the Italian Space Agency, notable for being the longest spaceflight of mice, lasting 91 days aboard the International Space Station.
STS-90, also known as NeuroLab, was a Space Shuttle mission that included experiments with mice to study the effects of microgravity on biological systems.
STS-108 was a Space Shuttle mission that involved various scientific experiments, including those with mice.
STS-129 was a Space Shuttle mission that included scientific research, including studies involving mice.
STS-131 was a Space Shuttle mission that included the 'Mouse Immunology I' experiment, focusing on immune responses in mice.
STS-133 was a Space Shuttle mission that included the 'Mouse Immunology II' experiment, further investigating immune responses in mice.
STS-135 was the final Space Shuttle mission, which also involved experiments with mice.

C57BL/6N is a widely used inbred strain of laboratory mice known for its genetic uniformity and suitability for various types of biomedical research. This strain is often chosen for studies due to its well-documented genetic background and the availability of extensive data on its physiological and behavioral characteristics.

The MSU Institute of Mitoengineering is a research institution focused on studying mitochondrial functions and their implications in various biological processes. It is involved in ethical oversight and approval of animal research protocols.

The Institute of Biomedical Problems (IBMP) is a research organization that conducts studies related to biomedical issues, including the effects of spaceflight on biological systems. It is responsible for ethical review and compliance in animal research.

Microgravity refers to the condition in which objects appear to be weightless and experience very small gravitational forces, typically occurring in space. This environment can significantly affect biological systems and physiological processes.

The TSE PhenoMaster is an automated data collection system used for monitoring animal behavior and physiological parameters in a controlled environment. It is designed to minimize stress on animals during research.

Cervical dislocation is a method used for euthanizing animals by dislocating the cervical vertebrae, leading to rapid death. This technique is often chosen for its effectiveness and minimal interference with research objectives.
Moscow State University is a prominent educational institution in Russia, known for its research and academic programs.

nodes.id: Shemyakin & Ovchinnikov Institute of Bioorganic Chemistry
nodes.description: This institute is involved in biological and chemical research, including the breeding of laboratory animals for scientific studies.
Baikonur Cosmodrome is a space launch facility in Kazakhstan, historically significant for launching the first human into space.
Orenburg is a city in Russia where the descent module of the Bion-M 1 biosatellite landed.
RFID chips are electronic devices used for identification and tracking, implanted in mice for individual identification in research.
Telemetry probes are devices implanted in animals to monitor physiological parameters such as blood pressure.

Techniplast is a company that specializes in the design and manufacture of laboratory animal housing and related products. They provide equipment such as individually ventilated cages for housing laboratory mice.
Biofizpribor is a Russian company involved in the development of hardware and technologies for biological and biomedical applications, including habitats for animals used in space research.
Baikonur is a space launch facility located in Kazakhstan, historically significant as the launch site for many Soviet and Russian space missions.
Moscow is the capital city of Russia and serves as a major center for scientific research and development, including biomedical studies.
The Bion program is a series of Soviet and Russian space missions designed to study the effects of spaceflight on biological organisms, including animals.
Assortiment Agro is a Russian company that produces standard pelleted food for laboratory animals.
T. Gurieva is a researcher at IBMP who contributed to the development of the 'space' paste food diet for mice.
E. Mednikova is a researcher at IBMP who collaborated with T. Gurieva in the development of the 'space' paste food diet for mice.
Data Science International is a company that provides telemetry hardware and solutions for monitoring physiological parameters in laboratory animals.

The Centre national d'études spatiales (CNES) is the French government space agency responsible for shaping and implementing France's space policy. They worked alongside Biofizpribor on the telemetry integration.
Bion-M is a biosatellite designed for biological and biomedical research in space. The telemetry hardware was integrated into this satellite for monitoring physiological parameters of the mice.
EthoVision v. 8 is a software tool used for analyzing animal behavior in research settings. It was utilized to analyze the video recordings of mouse behavior during the experiments.
Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce fever, pain, and inflammation. In this study, it was administered to the mice in drinking water during the recovery period.
Bactrim is an antibiotic medication used to treat various infections. It was also provided in the drinking water of the mice during their recovery.

edges.description: The Bion-M 1 mission primarily used male Mus musculus for physiological studies in microgravity.
Russia launched the Bion-M 1 biosatellite in 2013 as part of its biomedical research program in space.
Laika's successful flight in 1957 pioneered Russia's efforts in biomedical research with living organisms in space.
The Bion biosatellites program was conducted by Russia to study the effects of spaceflight on various animal species.
The C57/BL6 strain of mice was included in the Bion-M 1 mission for biomedical research.
The Bion-M 1 mission marked the resumption of Russia's biomedical research program in space after a 16-year hiatus.
Mice are utilized in spaceflight experiments to study biological adaptations to microgravity.
The Bion-M 1 mission studies the adaptation mechanisms of mice to prolonged microgravity.
The Mice Drawer System experiment was conducted aboard the International Space Station.
C57BL/6J is a specific strain of mice commonly used in biomedical research.
STS-90 involved experiments with mice to assess the effects of microgravity.
STS-108 included scientific experiments with mice.
STS-129 included experiments with mice.
STS-131 included the 'Mouse Immunology I' experiment with mice.
STS-133 included the 'Mouse Immunology II' experiment with mice.
STS-135 included experiments with mice.
Experiments involving C57BL/6N male mice were conducted under the approval of the MSU Institute of Mitoengineering.
The research involving C57BL/6N mice was also approved by the Biomedical Ethics Commission of IBMP.
The study aimed to investigate the effects of microgravity on the physiological systems of C57BL/6N male mice.
The TSE PhenoMaster system was used to monitor the behavior and physiological parameters of C57BL/6N mice during the study.
Cervical dislocation was the chosen method for euthanizing C57BL/6N mice for in vitro studies.
C57BL/6N is a specific strain of mice used in the study.

edges.target: Shemyakin & Ovchinnikov Institute of Bioorganic Chemistry
edges.description: The C57BL/6N mice were purchased from the Animal Breeding Facility of the Shemyakin & Ovchinnikov Institute.
The Bion-M 1 biosatellite was launched from Baikonur Cosmodrome.
The descent module of Bion-M 1 landed in the vicinity of Orenburg.
The animal facility for mouse training is part of the Institute of Mitoengineering at Moscow State University.
Mice were individually identified using RFID chips for tracking and research purposes.
Mice designated for in vivo studies were implanted with telemetry probes to monitor their physiological parameters.
The Bion-M 1 mission involved studying the effects of microgravity on the mice.

edges.relation: were part of the experiment on
edges.description: The mice were part of the Bion-M 1 experiment to observe biological responses in space.
Mice were sent into orbit as part of the Bion-M 1 space mission.
The Bion-M 1 mission was launched from the Baikonur space launch facility.
The Institute of Biomedical Problems (IBMP) managed the research involving the mice for the Bion-M 1 mission.
Mice were housed in individually ventilated cages provided by Techniplast during the experiments.
The habitats used for housing mice in-flight were developed by Biofizpribor according to IBMP requirements.
After the Bion-M 1 mission, the results and the mice were transported to Moscow for further examination.
Mice were maintained in stable cohorts of three during the training program and experiments.
Mice were used in the Bion program to study the effects of spaceflight.
Biofizpribor developed the hardware for mice housing in-flight according to the requirements of IBMP.
IBMP tested the habitats used for mice in the Bion program.
Assortiment Agro provides standard pelleted food for mice used in experiments.
T. Gurieva developed the 'space' paste food diet for mice at IBMP.
E. Mednikova collaborated with T. Gurieva in the development of the 'space' paste food diet for mice.
Techniplast provides metabolic chambers used for housing mice in experiments.
Data Science International provides telemetry hardware for monitoring arterial pressure in mice.
Mice had their arterial pressure monitored using telemetry hardware from Data Science International.
The telemetry hardware from Data Science International was integrated into the Bion-M biosatellite.
Biofizpribor adapted the telemetry system for integration into the Bion-M biosatellite.
The Centre national d'études spatiales (CNES) collaborated with Biofizpribor on the telemetry integration for the Bion-M biosatellite.
The behavior of the mice was analyzed using EthoVision v. 8 software.
Ibuprofen was administered to the mice in drinking water during their recovery period.
Bactrim was also administered to the mice in drinking water during their recovery period.
